image.altText: A cyclone track map for Tropical Cyclone Alfred.

props.synopsis: Tropical Cyclone could impact a heavily populated area extending from Bundaberg to south of the border. Follow the live updates.

image.altText: A radar image showing Cyclone Alfred on Monday.

props.synopsis: Tropical Cyclone Alfred is expected to make landfall this week, with authorities warning it could impact heavily populated areas across hundreds of kilometres of coastline.

title.children: Queensland premier warns cyclone could hit 'very populated' areas

image.altText: People filling up sandbags.

props.synopsis: It's the first time many people in south-east Queensland will experience the direct effects of a tropical cyclone, scheduled to make landfall later this week. Here's how you can make sure you're prepared.

title.children: Here's what you can do to prepare for Tropical Cyclone Alfred

image.altText: An older couple sit side by side in a waiting room, in front of a large sign that says "Medicare Urgent Care Clinic".

props.synopsis: The health minister says a historical quirk is behind why two-thirds of existing and promised Medicare urgent care clinics are in Labor-held seats, and they are committed based on need.

title.children: Is Labor pork-barrelling with its urgent care clinics?

image.altText: Close up headshot of Starmer and Zelenskyy talking.

props.synopsis: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer says the UK, France and Ukraine will devise a peace plan to end the conflict, as European nations vow to join a "coalition of the willing" to help Ukraine.Â

image.altText: An Indigenous AFL player lifts his shirt and points to the colour of his skin in response to racial vilification by the crowd.

image.altText: volunteers from the nsw state emergency service help locals sand bag ahead of tropical cyclone alfred

props.synopsis: New South Wales is preparing for a "pretty nasty set of weather" in the upcoming week, as Tropical Cyclone Alfred tracks away from the Queensland coast.

title.children: 'Unusual' warning to be issued for NSW ahead of Cyclone Alfred

A former NSW juvenile corrections officer jailed for sexually abusing five boys is appealing her conviction and prison sentence on the grounds she was the victim of a miscarriage of justice.

image.altText: A fillet of pink salmon seen on rocks.
